intro: Sophora chrysophylla f. haleakalaensis, commonly known as Haleakalā Sophora, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its bright yellow foliage, which contrasts with its deep green stems and branches. It thrives in the unique volcanic soil and microclimates of the Haleakalā National Park. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its natural environment.
